message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SE, cs.CY 

This paper discusses the security and monitoring of Certificate Transparency (CT) logs, which are used to ensure the validity of SSL/TLS certificates. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the use of monitoring-as-a-service, which involves continuous operation and inspection of logs, suggesting that it may also fall under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The use of gossip and auditing in CT logs may also relate to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper discusses the use of monitoring for wild-card domains, which may relate to cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper discusses the reduction of trust in monitors, which may relate to cs.CY (Computers and Society).
